newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCK HIGHLIGHTS - Q2 reports move stocks.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCK HIGHLIGHTS - Q2 reports move stocks.

text.p: Stock hit a new 52-week high of 52-13/16 after posting earnings per share of $0.86, just a penny above estimates, compared to $0.77 last year.

Clorox shares jumped to a new high of 139 after it posted second quarter earnings of $1.44 a share, beating a forecast of $1.38, and said it expected strong profits in 1998, with its domestic business performing well. It also said it expected growth in international margins.

Symantec shares surged in heavy Nasdaq trading after the Cupertino, Calif. company posted record earnings for its fiscal first quarter ended July 4, 1997. Earnings per share were $0.32 at the desktop software company, up over 400 percent versus the prior year first quarter. Shares moved as high as 23-3/8, a new 52-week high.

Stock falls more than ten percent. The company, which makes frame relay wide-area network access products, said fiscal fourth quarter revenues rose but earnings slipped to $0.01 from $0.09 a share last year.

ACT said profits were hurt by a delay in the consolidation of its DynaStar acquisition and a slowdown in wireless orders from two big customers in Latin America, which meant a $2 million shortfall from the third quarter. ACT also said it still expects some "lumpiness" as those customers install and sell networks, but expects increasing revenues from the Latin American region in the first quarter of fiscal 1998.
Shares fell in heavy trading after it posted a fiscal fourth quarter $0.06 loss, including a $0.15/share charge.
Although the maker of semiconductor chip processing equipment said it believes the worst is behind it, Merrill Lynch downgraded the stock to a near-term neutral.

The company said late Tuesday second quarter earnings were $0.18, up from $0.12 last year, but the stock tumbled over 30 percent at times and two brokerages cut their rating on the stock. The company was not immediately available for comment.
